abstract: The 11th edition of this popular problem-oriented coursebook introduces law students to the conduct of business in the world community. Problems on international contracting, financing, trade regulation, licensing and technology transfers, foreign investment, and international business dispute resolution are presented. The book provides a current, in-depth examination of issues that clients are likely to face, such as defending against import competition; expanding exports and overseas markets; and dealing with NAFTA, the WTO, and other trade agreements. The coursebook is designed to survey a wide range of laws involving trade, licensing, and investment, and explore how issues and problems are addressed by lawyers serving as problem solvers.
title: International Business Transactions: a Problem-Oriented Coursebook. 11th edition
subject: law
